arts.ttl: Reading to 'assess' goalkeeper after warm-up 'strain' at Northampton Town
arts.sum: Reading are to assess Joel Pereira ahead of Good Friday's tie with Lincoln City after feeling a 'strain' in his abductor ahead of Saturday's 0-0 draw at Northampton Town. The former Manchester United stopper pulled up in the warm-up at Sixfields but played the entire match with strapping, celebrating his 50th appearance for the Royals. Forced into one good save from Tyler Roberts' strike, the Portuguese goalkeeper was relatively untested throughout, but will be seen to before the visit of the Imps on Friday. "We will assess him tomorrow," said manager Noel Hunt. "He said he felt a little strain but was fit enough to carry on. Butts was there in the background too." Captain on the day, Lewis Wing, also needed treatment after falling awkwardly on th

arts.ttl: Reading boss on 'positive point' at 10-man Northampton Town as play-off push goes on
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt labelled the point picked up in this afternoon's 0-0 draw at Northampton Town 'positive' as their lead in the play-offs extends to three points. The Royals struggled to find their usual verve and vigour as over 1,500 supporters travelled to Sixfields. Kevin Nolan's Cobblers had the best chances, Joel Pereira forced into a good save on Tyler Roberts, while Charlie Savage's off-target side-footed effort was as good as it got for the visitors. This is despite former Royal Nesta Guinness-Walker receiving a sending off for two yellow cards with over 10 minutes remaining.
Nesta Guinness-Walker was sent off against his former club.

arts.ttl: 10-man Northampton Town hold play-off chasing Reading to competitive goalless draw
arts.sum: Reading were held to a 0-0 draw by ten man Northampton Town, extending the gap to seventh to three points. Former Reading defender Nesta Guinness-Walker received two bookings but Kevin Nolan's Cobblers were well-worthy of their point, shading the majority of the contest at Sixfields. Noel Hunt made three changes from Tuesday’s 3-1 victory at Shrewsbury Town, with Kelvin Abrefa and Tivonge Rushesha replacing Andy Yiadom and Andre Garcia at full-back. Jayden Wareham came into the front three as Mamadi Camara dropped to the bench. Northampton, fighting for points to ensure their survival in the division, started on top and remained there for the majority of the first half. Tyler Bindon gave them a helping hand inside three minutes, losing possession deep in Royal territory, but Ben Perry could not capitalise and found the side netting from inside the box. A real battle played mainly in the midfield, chances were few and far between.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Three changes for Northampton Town trip as squad remains unchanged
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt has made three changes for this afternoon's trip to Northampton Town. The Royals moved up to sixth in League One with Tuesday's 3-1 victory over bottom side Shrewsbury Town, a result which required a much-improved second-half performance. Joel Pereira remains in between the posts but two changes have been made to the backline, both at full-back, as Tivonge Rushesha and Kelvin Abrefa come in for Andy Yiadom and Andre Garcia.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading look to keep up play-off charge with Northampton Town trip
arts.sum: - Northampton Town v Reading - Team news from 2pm - Kick-off at 3pm

arts.ttl: Reading legend to act as Guest of Honour for Woodley Carnival tournament
arts.sum: Reading legend Glen Little will be the guest of honour at this year’s Woodley Carnival schools football tournament. The former winger was a key part of the Reading side that won the Championship in 2006 with a record 106 points and secured a place in the Premier League for the first time in the club’s history. Charlie Hiscox, who runs education business uSports, resurrected the Woodley Carnival football tournament last year, after it shut down in 2017 due to a lack of volunteers. Last year’s tournament featured 24 boys teams and 14 girls teams – with more girls teams expected to take part in this year’s tournament, which takes place at Woodford Park Leisure Centre in Woodley on Friday, June 13.

arts.ttl: Northampton Town boss hoping for a 'tired' Reading after three-game week
arts.sum: Northampton Town boss Kevin Nolan is hoping for a 'tired' Reading after Tuesday's midweek trip to Shrewsbury Town. The Royals are up in sixth following the midweek 3-1 win at Shrewsbury Town, a day in which the Cobblers did not play as they did not stop for international fixtures. As a result, Saturdays' trip to Sixfields will be the side's third match in seven days, albeit with two wins in that time the confidence will be high. Nolan, whose side sit two places and seven points clear of the relegation zone, will be hoping to face a weary Reading outfit.

arts.ttl: Reading fans implore parties to 'get the takeover done' as exclusivity period expires
arts.sum: Reading supporters have implored the new buyer to 'get a sale done' as the English Football League deadline approaches. The Royals, sat sixth heading into the final five League One matches, have spent two years putting out fires after owner Dai Yongge stopped funding the club. Disqualified as an owner in February for his debts in China, the EFL have extended the club's deadline until April 22 to sell or face possible suspension. American Robert Platek was in exclusive talks to buy the club, but this has now ended and former Wycombe Wanderers chief Rob Couhig is reportedly in talks to renew his attempt, after coming close to completing a deal in August. Reacting to the news, protest group Sell Before We Dai implored all parties to get this deal done.

Northampton are not home and dry just yet but the stunning 4-0 success at Peterborough firmly puts them on course for at least another season in League One. Despite their recent improvements, the Cob...
